Properties.Text: PC wakes up in prison, Morrok and he were captured. Caya breaks them both out but cannot open the chains on their hands.
Caya leads Morrok and PC to sewer entrance point. On the way PC can listen in on talk between Savia and commander Stetter, and Caya, Morrok and PC have to overcome suspicious guard.

Caya leads PC and Morrok through fortress, PC can listen in on the discussion between Savia and commander Stetter.

Stetter reprimands Savia because of her entering Castellum to catch petty thieves. Hint at her loosing command of her team

Guard is sceptical of Caya, PC and Morrok. PC can choose how to help out when dealing with him

Scene ends with team enters sewers
Commander Stetter interrogates PC
Savia takes PC to cells, asks some questions
PC is thrown into a cell, Em/Morrok sits in adjacent cell. PC and Em talk, warden tells them to be quiet, Caya comes in and knocks warden out, frees Morrok and PC
Savia and PC enter room, PC is put into cell, Savia leaves
PC and Morrok talk about what happened
Caya enters scene by knocking jailer out, frees Morrok and PC, lockpick breaks when trying to unlock handcuffs
PC, Morrok and jailer talk
Savia and her guards take PC and Morrok to fortress. There the guards give them over to the garrison who lead PC and Morrok to the interrogation room.
PC, Morrok and Caya flee through catacombs, guards on their heels. Trio escapes by climbing into hole
PC sees that magic dwells in the ruins.
Trio encounters ghoul, flees

Trio gets to the surface

Changing clothes?
PC, Morrok and Caya take a break in a safe room. PC gets to know their actual names.

PC meets Elisande and Boss.

Elisande opens PC shackles, Boss offers a job, PC accepts.

Elisande and Boss (not yet seen) in safehouse

Caya goes off to talk with Boss in next room

Elisande opens shackles

Caya enters scene and takes PC to other room

Boss offers that PC can work for him as thief

PC accepts

Everybody in one room

Morrok +, Elisande ~, Caya -

All but Elisande go to what will be PC's new home

PC gets sleep in proper bed
PC wakes up in bordello and talks with thieves who saved him. He sees a bit naughty stuff, then the city guard storms the house. PC gets knocked out.
PC hears suspicious talk of Morrok and Caya

PC realises Morrok is good/caring person

PC realises he may be only surviver

PC gives name, Morrok gives false name

Mage examination

Caya returns with Elisande (also bought healing ointments)

Elisande has some locks for PC to pick

Discussion about attack on ship

Rumour that Gunbald Durenar was killed

Elisande: "There are easier ways to kill one person. No, the attacker wanted attention."

Hint at darker side of Elisande, show Caya's disdain for city elite

It's evening, Boss returns and takes PC to friendly mage

Mage is old and eccentric, has a shy apprentice

Mage analyses whether PC has magical powers (he has not)

Mage and boss are glad because PC could have been dangerous

If PC tells them about Naverion, they will be concerned

Boss and PC return home

Caya and Morrok handled tavern so far

Regulars are suspicious of PC but relax once they see Boss treating him as one of their own

After most regulars left, Caya, Morrok and Elisande want to know what Boss and PC were doing

PC may tell the name Naverion but they don't know anything about it

Go to sleep

Talk about what to do now

Caya "Stay low. The city guard dogs are on the edge."

PC "You aren't talking about actual dogs, are you?"

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The woman sneaks from corner to corner, using anything as cover.

Her steps are almost silent, barely audible over muffled voices coming from somewhere in the fortress.

Em and you stay back until she gives the sign for you to follow. 

Em and the woman coordinate their movements entirely with small gestures. More often than not Em is already moving before the woman gives the sign.

He is moving as if he didn't feel any pain from before.

Your body however very much reminds you of the beating it had to endure. The pain takes it toll and makes you lag behind the others.

Despite that, the three of you make good progress.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: ...the Mages Guild want from them?

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text: They think those two are involved in destroying the ship.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: But they are only thieves!

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text: It is highly unlikely that these bunch of criminals just happen to be at the site of the attack, don't you agree?

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text:
Sir, I have observed them. I know what house they broke into that night.

It does not make sense for them to break into a house and then destroy a ship.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text: If they really are thieves, where is their loot?

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: I do not know where they hid it, sir. But why do you want them to be involved in the attack?

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text:
Do you know whose ship that was? That was one of Durenar's.

He might have been on the ship, he might have been killed.

What will the city council do if they find out that their head was murdered?

What will other criminals do if they think they can get away with it?

What will happen if the population doesn't respect the guard?

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text:
Unfortunately the guard could not prevent the attack.

But at least a young and courageous lieutenant managed to catch two of the attackers.

Even if she had to break some rules to get the job done.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: Sir... This is not right! As despicable as they are, these thieves are not responsible for the attack!

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text:
Not right?

What isn't right is you breaking the Castellum's autonomy just to catch some petty thieves!

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text:
You better pray that these two confess to the attack and you become the hero everyone wants!

If not, you will have to hunt thieves without a team, no matter what your family name is.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The silence is so deafening you fear that they hear your blood pulsating.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: His voice gets more and more soft, at the end benign even.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text: Good night, Savia.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: ...sir.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Her answer comes hesitantly. The commander gives her a nod, then he leaves her alone.

The lieutenant is still standing there as the commander's footsteps get quieter.

Finally she marches off in the opposite direction.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The commander gets more and more agitated. Finally he takes a deep breath and calms himself.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text:
The guard must deliver.

We must give them something.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Another pause.

He uses it to straighten his posture and change the tone of his voice.

Now the commander starts to sound as if he was holding a public speech.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
That is until you reach an intersection of hallways. Your leader stares at it, frowning.

As you wait for her to remember the correct way, you notice a light to your left.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Suddenly you hear people coming closer.

Em and the woman hectically gesture you to stay back. Then they quickly hide in a recess, you follow their example.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Through the blood pulsating in your ears, you can hear talk getting louder.

You recognise the two voices as the lieutenant and the commander.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text: I hope that will teach you to choose your battles more wisely.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You hear a door being slammed shut, then there is only silence again.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Their voices are so loud that they must be on the crossing right next to you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The steps stop.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You on the other hand have not even started to move.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Warm light shines through the keyhole of a heavy door. You hear muffled voices coming from the other side.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Em taps the woman's shoulder. She returns his questioning glance with a short reassuring nod.

With newfound decisiveness she crosses the hallway. Em moves in sync with her, not a moment later.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
With cautious movements you approach the door, careful not to make any noise with the chains hanging from your wrists.

You lower your head towards the keyhole.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You look into a large room lit both by torches hanging from the walls and the moon shining through a window. 

A large wooden tub filled with steaming water sat in the centre of the room. Some guards are in the room, bathing in the tub, undressing or drying off. 

On the room's far side there are racks for their equipment, in case of emergency only a few steps away from the women. But right now they seem to just savour the end of a long work day.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
...and then little Miss goody-two-shoes ordered you to march into the Castellum?

Shit, didn't think she had it in her.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You know what the kicker is? Our beloved lieutenant told us those two guys we hunted down were only thieves.

As if she'd mess with the Castellum just for some petty thieves. Milady probably thinks we commoners don't deserve to know the truth.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Suddenly you see something right next to you from the corner of your eye.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The woman looks at you, your face still next to the keyhole. Her expression is completely unmoving. 

Without telling you anything, she continues the way. Not a moment later Em follows her, entirely in sync with her.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Her body is still frozen in place. She has her head turned to you, so that the guard cannot see her face.

Her wide eyes are rapidly darting back and forth, apparently thinking hard about what to do next.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000055D2
Properties.Text: The fuck did you just call me?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text:
Come on!

Let's go!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
No regard for stealth left, the three of you rush through the fortress.

The commotion around you is getting louder. Orders are yelled and heavy footsteps echo through the hallways.

The woman makes a sharp turn, you follow her. A the end of the corridor is a lone guard watching over a staircase.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Careful not to make any more noise than necessary, you slowly come out of your hiding spot.

Em and the woman are already out, waiting for you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Good thing you came with us, eh?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text:
No time for chit-chat.

Keep going.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: She takes the lead again, ending all talks.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
0x01000000000055D2
Properties.Text: Who's there?

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000055D2
Properties.Text: Where are you taking those rats? Didn't hear anything about it.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The guard is about to walk past you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Instantly you freeze, as do your companions.

The voice came from the hallway behind you, a pair of feet are quickly coming closer.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You turn your head and see a single guard with a lamp walking up to you.

He gives Em and you a distrustful look which Em is returning in kind.

Then the guard turns his attention to the woman with the stolen uniform.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The guard grabs you by your throat, squeezing the air out of your lungs.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Before he passes you, you audibly spit at his feet.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Immediately the guard stops and grabs you by your throat, squeezing the air out of your lungs.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000055D2
Properties.Text: You are going to regret that, you fucking rat{nw]

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: A feet hits him right on his jaw, making him release your throat.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Flailing wildly with his arms, the guard unsuccessfully tries to soften his fall. 

With a loud thud he hits the wooden floor.

He has only time for a quick yell before the woman viciously stomps on his head.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Motionlessly, the man lies on the ground.

For a moment the hallway is dead silent.

Then you hear motion and agitated voices through the thick walls.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You can feel your heart beating against you chest while you wait for him to get closer.

It's probably just a few moments, but it feels agonisingly long.

Finally he reaches you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You tackle him against the stone wall. But the guard quickly recovers and is about to overpower you.

That's when Em enters the fray. The three of you go to the ground, wheezing and yelling in pain.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Finally Em gets a chokehold on the guard, squeezing until the man goes limp.

Still gasping, Em and you stand up.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You can feel your heart beating against you chest while you wait for him to get closer.

It's probably just a few moments, but it feels agonisingly long.

Finally Em springs into action.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
He lunges at the guard. The orc is stronger but the shackles hinder his movements. 

You enter the fray, trying to help Em. The three of you go to the ground, wheezing and yelling in pain.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The surprised man only manages to draw his sword before the kick hits him right in the chest.

He falls down the stairs, his armour clattering loudly on every step. The woman jumps over the guard and runs down even faster.

You follow them downstairs, the yells of other guards behind you.

At the bottom of the stairs you step over the groaning guard and enter a small room.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The woman makes a sharp turn, you follow her. A the end of the corridor is a lone guard watching over a staircase.

The woman does not slow down at all, if anything she gets even faster. Then she jumps.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
There is a open hatch in the floor, you can hear water flowing from below. The woman hangs of the edge and lets herself drop.

The noise of many guards echo down the stairs. You jump down into the darkness.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You look down at her hand.

She is tightly grabbing her dagger, it seems her grip is getting stronger.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: While the man writes something down on a sheet of paper you notice that someone else is standing beside you. A muscular guard is looking down at you, carefully watching all your moves.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
She gives the commander a brisk salute which he returns half-heartedly.

Without any warning the guard behind you lets go of your handcuffs, making you fall on your knees.

You don't have any time to rest as the guard already yanks you up and makes you walk out of the room.

But when the guard tries to lead you away the lieutenant stops him.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Without warning a strike hits you in the face. That one was much painful than the one that woke you up.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Your ears are still ringing as you come back to your senses.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text:
Two suspicious people were seen near the site of the attack, you and the orc you were arrested with.

I know you have got something to do with the attack.

Tell me what you did.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Tears are blurring your sight.

You think that you are drooling but you cannot feel your face anymore.

The only thing you feel right now is the seething pain in your stomach.

It takes some moments before you realise that the beating has stopped. You risk to squint through the tears.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
A sudden slap wakes you.

Instinctively you reach for your burning cheek, only to remember that your hands are cuffed together.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: After a moment you notice a pair of folded hands resting on the table, covered in smooth leather gloves.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Slowly you look up.

A man stares back at you from the opposite side of the table, his face bearing many old scars.

His expression is one of complete indifference, not moving any muscle unnecessarily.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text: Who are you?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The man in front of you is writing something down on a sheet of paper, looking almost bored.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text:
I am looking for the one that attacked the ship.

If you do not give me answers I can work with, you will get punished.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The interrogator lays down his quill and looks deep into your eyes.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text: What did you do at the site of the attack?

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text: Don't lie to me!

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text: I did not fish all those charred remains out of the canals only for you to tell me you survived unscathed!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The man closes his eyes and takes a deep breath. When he opens his eyes, he looks at you with the same indifferent face as before.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The interrogator looks to the man at your side.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Your ears are still ringing as you come back to your senses.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The interrogator looks to the man at your side.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text: Don't lie to me.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The room is so quiet you could hear a drop of water falling down somewhere.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Your ears are still ringing as you come back to your senses.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The interrogator looks to the man at your side.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text: Eventually you will talk. You are just making this hard for yourself.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You are hit on the temple. The pain instantly shoots through your head.

The punch came with such force that you and your chair fall to the ground.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The muscular guard doesn't give you a chance to recover, he pulls you up by your handcuffs right away.

The metal painfully cuts into your flesh, so you try to stand on your feet.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
A sudden punch to the stomach thwarts your plan.

You are left gasping for air while still hanging by your wrists.

The interrogator is standing in front of you, no ounce of compassion in his face. He gets ready to punch again.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text: How did you destroy the ship?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Sharp pain floods through your body.

Your mind can't help but wander off.

What the interrogator said didn't sound much like a question but rather an accusation or an order. 

His fist even struck you before he finished his question.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text: Did you kill the head of council because of his policies?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Your entire midsection feels like it was burning.

Instincts tell you to protect your stomach.

But your arms are still being held up mercilessly.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text: The sooner you confess the sooner this will end.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text: Did you trigger some explosion?

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: ...important matter!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The interrogator's view is still fixated on you, his chest rising with each breath.

It seems like he is listening to someone, someone behind the door.

You try to ignore the whirring in your ears and concentrate on what could be a woman's voice.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Your tormentor breathes out slowly. Then walks up to the door and opens it.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
A woman quickly salutes him.

She is the one that caught you and Em.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text:
Commander Stetter, a delegation of the Mages Guild has arrived!

They demand access to...

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
While pointing in your direction she takes a look inside. 

Her eyes widen when she sees the state you are in.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text: To what, lieutenant?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The lieutenant clears her throat and focuses back on commander Stetter.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: To the suspects my group and I apprehended, sir.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text: Tell them the Mages Guild has no authority over the city's internal policies.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: I already reminded them of the treaties, sir. But headmistress Halmara insisted on speaking with you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Commander Stetter sighs.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000068E
Properties.Text:
I will deal with her.

Put that filth in a cell.

And lieutenant? Don't call it a day yet, we are going to have a talk.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: Yes, sir!

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: I will take him from here.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The guard hands you over with no objections.

He mutters only a simple "Ma'am" and then goes on his way.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: I am the one who ploughed your mother last night. {w=1.0}{nw}

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You stare at the man, not making any effort to answer his question.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Only now you notice that there is someone else in the room.

A very muscular man looks down at you, frowning.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You see the lieutenant looking at nothing in particular, apparently lost in thought. She doesn't even notice you staring at her.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: She quickly focuses on you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: Why is the Mages Guild interested in you and the orc? You are only thieves!

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: Oh please. You expect me to believe that you just happened to break into the Castellum while in the company of another thief?

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: What? No!

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text:
Also?

Are you implying that the commander tried to make you confess to it?

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: Do tell.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The expression on her face hardens. She turns you around and pushes you in the direction of a stairway.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: Listen, if you tell me what is going on that might help your situation.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: Whatever.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The lieutenant looks deep into your eyes as if she was waiting for you to change your mind. Eventually she sighs and points at a stairway.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: Why not?

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: Down there.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The lieutenant sounds genuinely offended.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text:
I was on the ship when it was attacked.

There was some figure throwing a glowing ball on the ship and it exploded.

I got thrown off the ship and landed in the water.

That orc you arrested? He saved me from drowning.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: You are not only the sole survivor on the ship, you are also saying that the orc that I saw running away with the stolen goods actually saved you?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Careful not to slip on the slippery steps, you make your way down.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The lieutenant pushes you forward, directing you from behind. She is noticeably more lenient than before. Maybe because it is painfully clear that you couldn't offer any resistance even if you wanted to.

The building is completely quiet apart from you dragging your feet and her firm steps. The silence becomes uncomfortable as if the two of you didn't know how to start a conversation. 

You risk a look over your shoulder.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: What do you think happened in that room?

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: I rather want to know the truth about what you did.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Silently she stared at you for a bit.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The more she talks the more you notice her slightly posh accent.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: Quite a story. But it does not explain why you attacked us in the Castellum.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The lieutenant stares at you for a moment. Then she points at a stairway.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You enter a large cold room, your steps echoing from the stone walls.

An old and weathered man is sitting by a fireplace, staring at a piece of paper rather than reading it.

Moonlight shines through a single small window high up on a wall, the only source of light for a hallway with metal doors.

Once the two of you step into the jailer's field of view he perks up, the key ring at his side rustling.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000045E0
Properties.Text:
Miss Falksteyn! A pleasure to see you!

So this is the other one?

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: He is. The Commander ordered to put him into a cell until further interrogation.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The jailer eyes you thoroughly.

Apparently he doesn't consider you to be a threat because he diverts his attention back to the lieutenant.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000045E0
Properties.Text: Of course, miss Falksteyn. Please follow me.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You turn around to see the lieutenant still standing there, looking at you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000045E0
Properties.Text:
How does it feel to finally lead a team, miss Falksteyn?

It is different to what they teach you in the academy, isn't it?

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: I am afraid I have no time to talk, the commander wants to speak with me.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: She stares at you for a moment, then she shakes her head. Less in response to what you said, rather to what she was thinking.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: I will, thank you very much.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: She stares at you for a moment, apparently lost in thought. Then she shakes her head.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: She turns and marches away, the echos of her steps still audible when she is long out of your sight.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The cells are next to the room with the fireplace. The jailer opens one of them for you.

In order to avoid being pushed you decide to go into the cell voluntarily. You hear the door closing behind you, the key clicking in the lock.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: You alright?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: [player_character.name], that you?

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: Yeah.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: They beat the shit out of me though.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Gotta see the positives: The pain is just weakness leaving our bodies.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: I fail to see the positives after being beaten halfway to death and thrown into prison for a crime I didn't commit.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Life's already shit enough. A good mood makes it more bearable.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: The honourable Fovis city guard going easy on a greenskin?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You hear him half laughing, half coughing.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
You should tell them that one!

They might finally realise you did actually just arrive here with the ship!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Talking about shit...

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Did they also blame you for attacking the ship?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Em takes a deep breath and calms down.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: That man... the commander did. He and his lackey beat me if I didn't tell him what he wanted to hear.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: And what did you say?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
There is a moment of silence.

Then, Em breaks out in hysterical laughter. Between his cackles and gasps for air, he manages to string some words together.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Out of all people to talk shit to... you chose Allaus fucking Stetter... commander of the Fovis city guard?

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: If it makes any difference, there were not that many other people around to insult.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
And still beat you for it? Doesn't surprise me.

They don't care about stuff like truth.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: I kinda doubt it makes a difference...

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Em takes a deep breath and sighs.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: Sounds like you have some experience with them.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
Yeah, probably wouldn't have mattered no matter what you say.

They are just gonna beat us anyway.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Fucking thugs in uniforms, that's what they are.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Find me some non-human that doesn't.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: They are gonna make us the fucking scapegoats for the attack on the ship...

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text:
Not all of them. That one lady officer who arrested us didn't seem to know about it.

She kept calling me a thief.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Em stays suspiciously silent.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: You are a thief, aren't you?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Both the jailer and the attacker fall out of your line of sight, only the jailer's unmoving legs are visible. You hear the metallic rustling of the jailer's key ring.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Hey, what is going on there? [player_character.name], are you alright?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: Shut up, you idiot!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The woman's voice is sharp like a whip, putting extra emphasis on the hard word endings.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Oh you beautiful woman, I never doubted you for a second!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Another rustle from a key in a lock and you hear a door swing open.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: No hugs. And be quiet! Or the whole fortress will hear you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: We have to get him out too!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: I am not breaking out random people.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
The dogs want to blame the attack on the ship on him, they will execute him!

I won't leave until he's free.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: Fucking heavens...

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: There is a pause before you hear Em's indignant voice.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The woman walks up to the your cell and swiftly opens your door. She examines you from head to toe, her face not moving at all.

Finally she looks at the keyring she took from the jailer.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: Which ones of those are for the shackles?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
Prolly none, those are for the cells. Maybe that lieutenant who arrested us gave the keys to the jailer.

I'mma search the room for em while you take the shackles off our new best buddy [player.name] first, yeah?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Without answering she knelt down to you and ungently grabbed your wrist.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Then she pushed a small metal bar into the lock and moved it up and down, just like you had seen Em do in the Castellum.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Then she pushed a small metal bar into the lock and moved it up and down.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The woman is completely concentrated on picking the lock, a slight frown on her face.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: She rewards your question with cold silence, not even looking up at you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The jailer is in a wide stance, about to tackle the woman.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Completely taken by surprise the woman falls back, barely missing the jailer's attack.

The jailer plunges on you instead.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The warning came too late as the jailer already plunges on her, pushing her into you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
As you regain your senses you see the jailer lying on the ground face down, not moving a limb.

The woman is standing above him, looking down at him and controlling her breath.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: What in the fuck happened here?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: He woke up and attacked.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Her demeanour is nonchalant, as if there wasn't a man lying on the ground motionlessly.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: You wanna stick around to see if he wakes up?

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: Is he dead?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Not waiting for an answer she kneels down to the ground, apparently searching for something.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: Dropped my pick. Help find it.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: As you are about to do the same, you notice something sticking out of your shackle.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: What do you mea- Oh. Oh no.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text:
Great. Just great.

Alright, no time to get the shacks off. We leave now.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Works for me.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
She immediately walks out of the cells and motions you to hurry up.

Once you are out she closes the cell. While locking it with the jailer's keys, she speaks to Em and you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: If someone sees us, you two are prisoners and I am your guard leading you through the fortress.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: Sewer system under the fortress.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: This isn't a discussion. We are going. Follow us or don't.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Without looking back, she climbs up the stairs. Em quickly follows and motions you to do the same.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Out of the corner of your eye you notice some motion.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Em takes a look at you, then at the jailer, sighs and gets on his knees to search.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: Found half of the lock pick.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: A thin metal device stuck in the lock... and broken off just outside the mechanism.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Em is interrupted by a loud creaking sound. The jailer comes into your view, he drags a stool in front of the cells.

With a final thump, he places it well out of your arm's reach and sits on it.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000045E0
Properties.Text: Don't mind me, please go on.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Why should I? You'll just twist every word I say.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000045E0
Properties.Text:
No, I just want to talk. And folks in here usually do too.

More often than not my guests find it rather liberating to speak freely.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000045E0
Properties.Text: Maybe not now. But eventually most do.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000045E0
Properties.Text: I am afraid you will have to bear my presence for the time being.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Are your usual "guests" also imprisoned for crimes they didn't do?

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000045E0
Properties.Text: It is not uncommon for them to claim to be innocent, yes.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000045E0
Properties.Text:
In the end it doesn't matter how guilty you are.

If sentencing you is what it takes to keep the peace, then it is what must be done.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: I also happen to be innocent.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000045E0
Properties.Text: It's understandable if you do not agree with that line of thinking, especially in your situation.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000045E0
Properties.Text: And that is exactly what the commander does.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000045E0
Properties.Text:
You are probably too young to remember the chaos before the commander took office.

He made a lot of decisions that many would question. I questioned him too, back then.

Allying with the bad to defeat the worse. Sometimes fighting the wrong ones.

But in the end, he restored the peace in the Fovis.

He saw the bigger picture when no one else did.

I thoroughly trust in commander Stetter's judgement.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
I don't give a shit about how you tell yourself that you are not evil.

Why don't you stop sucking your commander's cock and kill me right now? Better than to listen to your crap.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The jailer sighs and gets up from his stool slowly. 

He comes a few steps closer to your cell but still stays out of arms reach.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000045E0
Properties.Text:
That greenskin there is trying to provoke me so that I open the cell.

Obviously I will not.

I just want to have a civil chat with you. Will you be as rude as the greenskin?

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: It's hard to have a civil chat with som-{nw}

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: Will you please shut up and go fuck-{nw}

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: At least you are polite about killin-{nw}

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000045E0
Properties.Text:
It is not my job to determine your guilt.

I am just here to make sure you don't try to escape.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The jailer takes a pipe out of his pockets and calmly lights it.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You cannot see much as the guard keeps pushing your head down, barely enough to avoid things to trip over.

But from your peripheral vision you can make out onlookers. You can almost feel their prying eyes all over your body.

With each passing step you are getting more and more tired.

Now that the stress from before wears off, exhaustion threatens to overcome you.

But you are not alone in that, you notice how your captors are yawning here and there.

Suddenly they make you stop. You twist your head to look where you have been lead to.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Dark, almost pitch black walls tower above you, casting a shadow so that not even the moonlight reaches you anymore.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000004F47
Properties.Text: Welcome back, Ma'am. Your orders?

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: Put these two captives into interrogation rooms.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The guard tells her men to take over Em and you.

Your new captor exerts much more force on you, as if wanted to remind you that he is in charge now.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: Is the commander in the base?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000004F47
Properties.Text: No, Ma'am. I think he is still coordinating the relief efforts at the site of the attack.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: Very well. My team and I will go there too.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You cannot hear the end of the talk as you are already being pushed to walk further.

Silently the guards lead you through many corridors and stairways of the complex. 

Up and down and left and right... {w=0.5} Enough to make one think that they are leading you in circles on purpose.

Finally you reach your destination, some plain but heavy looking doors.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: With a rough final shove you stumble into the room, barely avoiding the table and chairs in it.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The guard behind you quickly slams the door shut, plunging the room into darkness.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The gate opens and reveals a couple of guards with halberds. While your group walks in one of the halberdiers salutes the woman holding you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
With a splash you hit muddy, knee-deep water. Its stench is so defeaning you can almost taste it.

As you cough, you get pulled aside. Suddenly there is another splash, then you hear Em groaning.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: Come on!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
In the complete darkness you just follow the sounds of her trudging through the water.

You still hear the guards, they must have reached the room above. But apparently they don't jump down after you three, at least not immediately.

You continue your way as fast as you can, not to be left alone in the pitch black canal.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Suddenly the sewer gets illuminated with a dim light. Wet walls and vines to your right and left reflect the unnaturally cold light.

Slowly you realise that whatever that light is, it is coming from the woman's hand. Neither Em nor the woman explain what is happening to you. All of you are just panting and gasping for the stinking air.

The sewer does not go straight, instead it bends in seemingly random ways.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
After yet another corner a gateway comes into view. It is made of rusty metal bars and vines hang from the top.

In front of the gate another canal is intersecting the one you came from. Not taking a moment to consider, the woman does not go the gate but makes a turn instead.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
She then goes to a section of a wall particularly overgrown with vines. With her right hand she digs through the vines while shining with her left hand.

Finally you see the thing making the cold light up close. It's a metallic plate, containing a shimmering blue essence.

The woman uncovered an opening in the wall, a steep stairway going up. It was almost impossible to see in the dark sewers, even without the vines.

Without saying anything she makes her way through the vines. Not wanting to be left in the dark, you follow her. The sticky vines cling to your body a bit, leaving some slime on you.

Then you literally climb up the stairs, using both of your hands to feel for the steps.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Silently you walk through empty corridors, devoid of any kind of life. The loudest sounds are the ones your wet boots make when hitting the stone floor.

There might be something else echoing ever so faintly through the long hallways. But maybe it is just your own mind playing a trick on you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Slowly the hallway begins to change. The hewn bricks and plates gradually make way for rougher, untreated stones.

The tunnel now doesn't look anything like a manmade hallway anymore. The ground became so uneven that you have to almost climb over the slippery rocks to move forward.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Almost there.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Morrok's sudden voice cuts through the silence, even though he was whispering.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: What? Where?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: You'll see.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
As you continue your way through the tunnel, you start to notice that Caya's disk is not the only light. Wherever the tunnel leads you, the blue ambient light seems to get brighter.

With a flick of her hand, Caya turns off her light. The tunnel immediately becomes dark but your eyes quickly adjust to the dim light. You follow the woman around another corner.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Dots of blue light shine from the walls, piercing through the darkness of the stone like stars on a cloudless sky.

Manmade pillars lie in ruins, their purpose long forgotten. The structures feel out of place, as if they were just guests about to leave.

You too feel like a foreigner, stumbling into the majestic halls of a gracious king. Wanting to take a closer look at the lights, you cautiously walk up to one of the walls.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The lights break through the stone in irregular patterns, almost like grain in wood. Each time you move new parts of the wet surface are glistening. It's almost as if the room wasn't just made up of raw materials, but a living organism instead.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Suddenly Caya enters your field of view.

She doesn't say anything, she just stares at you with her arms folded.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The woman turns to look at the wall. Her eyes follow a long vein of lights breaking through the stone.

Eventually she turns to you again.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: Come on, let's go.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The whispering does not fit the abrupt way she marches off to the exit.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: They are magic, did you expect anything else?

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: What about your magic disk?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text:
Could destroy the another ship for all I know.

Let's go.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: She marches off to the exit, not waiting for you to answer.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You reach out to touch the glistening walls.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Caya immediately jerks your hand away from the wall. Still grabbing you by your wrist, she hisses some words at you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: How about we don't touch the glowing magic stones?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text:
Do you also try to touch fire because someone holds a candle?

Just don't touch the fucking stone.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: Come on. Let's go.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Caya lets go of your wrist.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Caya shoves your wrist away.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: Keep your hands to yourself.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Morrok is already there, waiting for you to come up.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: That glowing stuff's called Lavirium.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: ...probably?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
It's not like we're not mining it day in day out, eh?

Don't you worry!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Morrok's cheery words echo through the room.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
As long as we're here only for a short while, we're fine.

You can probably even touch raw Lavirium without anything happening!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: And keep going.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: A shriek answers from the tunnel.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Caya springs into action. She grabs you by your arm and dives behind a rock big enough to hide you both.

Clenched in her fist, you see her dagger, ready to to stab anyone -{wait=0.5} or any*thing*.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: A few steps away from your hiding spot you see Morrok crouching behind one of the columns. Careful not to move his wrists, he tries to avoid making any sounds.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Apart from the shallow breaths of the three of you, the room is dead silent.

{wait=0.5}.{wait=0.5}.{wait=0.5}.

The time drags out. It cannot have been more than just a few moments, but it feels like you have been sitting here for hours now. Your joints are stiff from your posture, yet you don't dare to change it.

You start to believe that you just imagined the scream- {wait=0.5}{nw}

You hear sniffing.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Cold sweat spreads over your body.

Whatever you are hiding from, it is here now.

It is on the other side of the rock.

You don't dare to breath, let alone move.

Suddenly, a scraping sound breaks the dead silence. 

It comes from right above you, from the very stone you hide behind.

Cautiously you look up.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Fingers, fingers of a hand that does not belong to a human, elf or orc.

They are long and slender, but the vicious claws look like they could easily tear apart your flesh.

It looks almost tender how they stroke the rock, if it weren't for the claws audibly scraping the stone.

Another sniff.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Caya narrowly dodges the creature's claws.

She holds her dagger in front of her, trying to keep the monster away from her.

But the creature still continues with its unrelenting slashes.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
It gets through Caya's defence and hits her on the hip.

The hit throws the elf away, the hard landing making her grunt in pain.

Out of some corner in the darkness her dagger clangs against the stone floor.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Morrok throws himself at the monster's back, his wordless scream half anger, half panic.

He manages to stay behind the creature's back, out of reach of its slashes.

With all his weight he pulls the chain back, trying to strangle the monster.

But the creature doesn't seem to be affected by Morrok at all. 

If anything, its slashes just seem to get angrier. It will be only a matter of time until the monster gets him.

Next to you Caya lies on the ground. Visibly exhausted, she tries to get back up on her feet.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Your feet lose contact with the ground.

As you fly through the air, you start to think about- {w=0.5} {nw}

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Just in that moment the monster shakes off Morrok with a victorious scream.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You pick up the disc glowing with weak blue light.

In its cold metallic surface there are protrusions right where your fingers hold the disc.

As you hold the disc, you inadvertently push in those protrusions. Immediately the light of the disc gets brighter the further you push.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Quickly you pick up the dagger and return to the fight.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You step in front of the monster, the light disc in your hand.

With all the strength that your fingers have left, you squeeze the protrusions on the disc. 

A glaring light radiates out of the disc. For a moment you too are blinded even though you are not even on the receiving end.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Morrok gets up

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Caya yells to follow her out of room

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Morrok tells PC to keep monster away while he leads PC into right direction

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
PC, Caya and Morrok run further into tunnels, PC always turning back to blind ghoul

Trio reaches door made of metal bars, closes door behind them

Ghoul reaches for them through the bars

Trio stands in front of door

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Ghoul hits door, metal bars deform

Trio runs away, sounds of metal screeching and ghoul shrieking behind them

Trio continues on, until they don't hear monster anymore

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: Not so tough now, are-{wait=0.5}{nw}

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: Come on, we have to keep-{wait=0.5}{nw}

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: How long's that door gonna-{wait=0.5}{nw}

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Hitting the ground quickly pulls you back to your situation.

At first it's just a tingling, but soon your chest feels like it will burst. That's where the monster's backhand hit you and send you flying.

On all fours you cough out, leaving a bitter aftertaste.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
As you examine the ground for the dagger, Caya stands up.

She charges the creature, clutching her helmet with her hands as if it were a weapon.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
With your hands under her arm you start to pull her up, but she declined.

Her eyes fixated on the monster, she unfastens the helmet from her belt.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text:
We need something to fend it off!

Look for my dagger!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Not straining her hoarse voice any more, she charges the creature. 

Her right hand clutches the helmet, as if it were an actual weapon.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You get down on the ground, trying to spot the light reflection on the dagger in the dark.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Something catches your eye.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Suddenly you hear the victorious scream of the monster. It has shaken off Morrok of its back.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
With vicious blow after vicious blow the creature pushes Caya back.

Only by using her helmet as a shield she avoids being hit, each time with a metallic resonance echoing through the cave.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Screaming in pain, the creature tries to shield its eyes from the light.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Morrok "Everybody alright?"

PC "I'm fine..."

Caya "Peachy."

Caya is bleeding from some wound (head wound?)

PC can either be concerned about Caya or directly ask about what that thing (ghoul) was

Discussion will be about ghoul any way

Morrok "Why was it there? I thought it lives in the spiral section!"

Caya "I don't fucking know!"

Caya: "The exit is close. Let's get the fuck out of here."

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Walk through corridors, upstairs

Get to sewer part

Climb into abandoned house

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
End up in room similar to the on in 003_catacombs/talk

Caya: "Give me the light, it'll burn out with that intensity"

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: *I{wait=0.5} am{wait=0.5} fine.*

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Caya speaks to you through clenched teeth while giving you a defiant look.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
Caya, don't be an idiot.

Let him check your wounds.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
For a moment, Caya just stares at you.

Then she lifts the rim of the top, exposing her waist.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
A dark spot on her pale skin gets revealed, about on the height of where her belt has been.

Fortunately, you don't see blood exiting the wound.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: The wound is not open. It's probably just a bruise.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Caya immediately pulls down the cloth and presses her hand on the bruise again.

If she's feeling any pain, she's hiding it.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: Told you it was nothing.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: You learn to live with it.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: Oh, shut it.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Caya looks away, slight smile.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
I may have some explaining to do...

First off: My name's not Em, it's Morrok.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Nothing against you, but I am not just going to tell some random guy my real name while running from the guard.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You crawl through the darkness until you eventually reach the light at the end of the stairs. The woman stands in the middle of the cold but dry room.

Once you enter the room you first sit down against the wall. You breathe in the air that must be stale but to you it seems so fresh compared to the air in the sewer.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Need a... quick breather...

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The woman stares at the two of you for a moment. Then she sits down as well and begins unstrapping her helmet.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
As she exhales, the tension in her body relaxes. She rests the back of her head against the stone.

Pointy ears stick out of the short, sweaty hair.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: Careful, he's a fast one.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: She throws a questioning glance at the orc.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: But you aren't just some random guy anymore!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
We already fought guards together!

We are brothers in arms!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
That one works well, eh?

I just hope nobody's gonna make me try speak actual orcish...

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
Gotta be in this kinda work.

'specially when you happen to be born an orc.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: But enough about me!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: As for our sister in arms...

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
That ray of sunshine over there is Caya.

Caya - [player.name].

We two are part of a band of merry thieves!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The woman doesn't even look at you, instead she stares at Morrok with squinted eyes.

Morrok returns her grouchy expression with a big grin.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: We are certainly not in the sewers anymore.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
's the catacombs under the city!

They're ancient as fuck, probably built by some elves back then. Nobody knows what they what they were there for, so they just use the outer layers as sewers.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
Anyway, nobody's got a full map of em. The deeper you go into the maze the harder you'll find the way out. That alone keeps most people out of here.

The guards would never follow us here, they don't know the catacombs as well as we do!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: It's a magic artefact.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: She says it as if that short sentence explained everything.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: ...yes. I am the first mage that gives up living in the mages' castle and instead lives as a thief wading through sewage.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: Shines blue.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Caya takes a look at you and nods ever so slightly.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Instead of answering he gets up bit by bit, grunting at each step of the process.

Caya stands up as well but unlike the orc in one swift and smooth motion.

Morrok scowls when seeing the elf's agility.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The woman turns her head away from you, ending the little talk you had.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
I could be more flexible... 'm fine.

These cold stones are getting uncomfortable anyway, eh?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Caya is taking the lead again, already leaving the room.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Em - no, *Morrok* - smiles apologetically.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
You are the one that told Commander Stetter mom jokes!

That alone makes you one of the good ones for me!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: ...he did *what*?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Ah - right, forgot to introduce you...

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
You are an expert at distracting the guards so we all can escape!

Teamwork makes the dream works, eh?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: As for the final part of this team...

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Shortly after Em climbs up and sits down against the wall too.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Trio climbs into abandoned house

Voice behind PC (Elisande): "Who is your friend?"

PC turns, sees smiling woman, doesn't see her hand

Morrok "That's our new best buddy [player.name]! [player.name] - Elisande, Elisande - [player.name]."

Elisande looks to Caya, Caya nods

Elisande puts back knife she had in hand PC couldn't see

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Elisande (to Caya, looking up and down, smiling) "You look like shit."

Caya "How'd you look if you met a ghoul?"

Elisande (to Caya) "He wants to talk with both of you, especially you"

Caya "I imagine he does... Pick broke, open their shackles"

Elisande "How could I say no if you are asking so nicely?"

Elisande opens Morrok's shackles in blink of an eye

Elisande looks at PC's shackles "That might take a while. You can go on and have a talk with the boss / Gerbald"

Caya sighs, she and Morrok go

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Elisande turns to PC, smiling sweetly

Doesn't touch him, but teases him by showing skin

"So you are the one Morrok saved from the water, aren't you?"

PC mentions speaking with the commander Stetter, Elisande wants him to tell her everything about Stetter

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Morrok comes in "How long does it take?"

Elisande "I am about done here"

Elisande opens lock in an instant "There you go"

Morrok to PC "Come with me"

Morrok leads PC to room with Boss

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Morrok leads into dusty room.

Old table and chairs, maybe have some elevation towards Boss' side of the room

Caya and Boss at opposite side of room. Caya staring at PC with no discernable expression. Boss standing at window looking outside, back to PC.

Boss "You two can leave us."

Caya stares daggers at PC, Morrok tries to look encouragingly

Boss "Sit down, [player.name]."

Boss turns around, face not yet visible due to lighting (harsh light from window, few lights to face)

Boss "So you are the one that survived the explosion?" (build tension by making player believe Boss could have something to do with bombing)

PC confirms

Boss "Tell me what you saw"

PC explains up until waking up in Castellum

Boss "Morrok already told me." (additional statements depending on what PC did during c001-3)

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Boss "Why did you come to Fovis?"

PC answer leads to current situation ("Originally I wanted...")

Boss "And what do you plan to do now that the guard is searching for you?"

PC doesn't know what to do

Boss sits down, face becomes visible

Boss "Work for me and I'll provide you with shelter and food."

PC options in the following conversation:

"Work as what?" - "Morrok already told you what we do."

"Do I have a choice?"

"Yes! Thank you, thank you for helping me!" - "Don't misunderstand me. I am a business man, not a charity."

After accepting, Boss insists on shaking hands

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Boss leads PC out of room

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Boss leads PC into room with Caya, Morrok, Elisande, the three look at Boss and PC

Boss gives PC's back a pat "Anon is the newest member of our group."

Show reaction of the three (maybe Morrok prominently?)

Boss "He's got nowhere to go in Fovis, so he'll stay in the inn."

Show Caya frowning

Boss "You three will show him the ropes of the work. Teach him how to get where they don't want you to be, how to remain unnoticed and how to get rid of the guard."

Boss "Elisande, you will start tomorrow by teaching him how to pick locks."

Show Elisande smiling mischievously at PC

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Boss "But for today, let's just go home and you three get some rest. It's been a long day for you."

Boss takes out capes for PC, Caya, Morrok so they'll get less attention in the streets

Boss "Take these. You'll still smell like sewage, but at least you won't look like it right away."

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Everyone goes outside, blinding light, streets full of people going on with their daily life, maybe mage castle far in background

Morrok "Welcome to Fovis!"

Describe people noticing bad smell of Morrok, Caya and PC; talk about explosion and destroyed ship, rumour that Durenar is dead

Characters talk about some irrelevant stuff until they are near Elisande's house or the inn

Elisande "Well then, You don't need my assistance for washing yourselves. I'll be at my house."

Elisande leaning towards PC's ear "I will see you tomorrow."

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
PC, Morrok, Caya and Boss enter inn. Maybe boss has some other guy in group standing at the counter?

Boss leads to washing room. Different washing cabins, curtain between cabins. Morrok and PC take one, Caya the other.

Trio takes off clothes, Caya's outline visible on curtain

Morrok and PC talk about something, maybe Morrok will tell PC about training

Options:

Ignore: 

Stare at Caya's outline: Morrok will playfully splash water at PC

Try to peek: Morrok will audibly prevent PC from seeing anything 

Morrok -, Caya -

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Bathing done, PC gets new set of clothes

Boss shows PC his new room

PC goes to sleep (undresses)

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: ...supposed to do? Let him drown back there? Nobody would have seen him!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: Immediately dropping everything wasn't the only option.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: 'twas a matter of life and death, I had to do something! Besides, I didn't drop everything. We still got your bag.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: Great, that's just great.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: He's waking up. Time to go.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: But we still got to make sure he's okay!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000425
Properties.Text: Are you fu- You know what? Fine. He is your problem. I'm leaving.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The woman quickly leaves the room, making the man sigh. Then he turns to you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Hey there buddy, everything alright?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The orc smiles at you while you come back to your senses. Your throat feels so raspy that you have to cough.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Easy, easy!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
While you are hunched over, the orc pats you on the back. Only now you realise that you are not wearing your shirt anymore.

The orc is patiently waiting for you while you collect yourself.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: That's the spirit!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Asking the important questions first, eh? Your stuff's still drying.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
There was a ship and it... exploded? I saw you in the water and got you out.

What happened back there?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: ..."at us"?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
You were on the ship when it exploded?

But it was completely blown up, there's nothing left of it!

How did you survive that?

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: There is nothing left of the ship?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
Listen, I didn't really stick around, but the situation seems bad. The ground was shaking, even the houses nearby got damaged...

What I am trying to tell you is that you got really, *really* lucky to get outta there with just a couple of bruises...

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The orc shifted uncomfortably in his seat.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The orc opens his mouth only to close it again, it seems like he doesn't know what to say.

Neither do you for that matter. You still need to process what he told you.

The whole ship was destroyed by an explosion just a couple of feet away from you?

But you survive with some minor injuries and some water in your lungs?

...water in your lungs.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text:
You saved me from drowning, didn't you?

Thank you.

What's your name?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
Oh, err, 'tis an Orcish name that's difficult to pronounce.

But you can call me Em!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The orc leans back, with some of his tension relaxing.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text:
Thank you, Em, I owe you my life.

You can call me...

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Suddenly Em stands up and gives you a toothy grin.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Now let's get you some clothes! Can't have you die of a cold after saving you from drowning, can I?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: With a bounce in his step he gestures you to follow him.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Alright, nice to meet you, [player_character.name]!

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: That woman you were speaking with, who was she?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Oh, she's a work buddy, you kinda interrupted our work.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: She sounded like she would've let me drown.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Don't worry! If I wasn't there, she would have gotten you out of the water... I think.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: You dropped something to save me?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: You heard that? That was just stuff for work, tools and so on. Don't you worry about that!

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: What do you work as anyway?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Oh you know, cleaning the sewers and such.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
At the moment, all the attention is on Em. Maybe you could get away unnoticed.

Instead, you could also try get them off Em.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You look around for something you could use as a weapon.

Next to the guard lying on the ground is woodpile of what has probably been a crate before.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Cautiously you sneak towards the door.

Fortunately for you they are all still distracted by Em struggling.

You reach out to the door handle.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Your hit connects, you feel the vibrations through the wood. The man cries out in pain and drops his baton.

Before he can react, you take another strike at him.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
With all the might you can muster, you ram your knee into his unprotected groin.

The man winces, his face distorted by pain. Quickly you push him off, get up and run towards the door.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The leader of the guards doesn't wait for you to finish. She pushes you face first into the wall while twisting your right arm behind your back.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: Talk all you want, thief.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Without a further word, she pulls you off the wall.

The rest of the guards managed to subdue Em in the meantime. 

After picking up their still dazed comrade, they lead the two of you out of the building and on the streets.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The yell came from the man that stopped you and Em in the hallway. A woman in armour is pressing him against the wall twisting his arm behind his back.

Behind the two you see some other people approaching, they are wearing the same kind of armour as the woman.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The city guard isn't allowed to patrol here!

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text:
We are not patrolling, we are chasing two criminals. One of them is an orc. 

Will you work with us or will you continue to hinder the work of the guard?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
I saw some suspicious greenskin and a man!

Now let go of me, woman!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: She releases the man at once, making him fall to his knees in surprise. While cautiously checking his hurt arm, he speaks to the woman.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
I saw them in this hallway, they told me they were servants and looking for clothing.

They went in that direc-{nw}

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: STOP RIGHT THERE, GREENSKIN!
