Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You can hear something breaking to pieces, followed by more loud shouting.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text:
Everyone on me!

You too, you will identify them!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The woman and her soldiers waste no time and run towards the noise.

Reluctantly, the man picks up his baton and chases after the group of city guards.

You follow the guards with some distance.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Finally Em comes into your view. Multiple city guards try to pin him to the ground by grabbing his limbs.

Among them is the woman who gave the orders. Without looking back she speaks to the man standing by.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: Is that the orc you have seen?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Yes! Must be him.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: WATCH OUT!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: That's the other one!

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: I think you are looking for me.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: That's the other one!

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: But you are mistaking me for some-{nw}

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Cautiously you put your head out in the hallway while the noise is getting louder.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
He is oblivious to you sneaking up on him.

You line up the swing to your victim and-{w=0.25}{nw}

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You swing the plank at her.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The woman pushes you face first against the hard wall.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Immediately you are pulled back into the room and thrown to the ground.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You try to grab hold of him but he manages to land some hits on your fingers in response.

While you pull back your hurting hands he takes aim at your head, triumphantly grinning at you.

But even if he can hinder you from grabbing or punching him, that still doesn't leave you defenceless.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Suddenly, you get pushed into the wall. The guards' leader is holding you in place.

You try to break free, but she twists your right arm behind your back painfully.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The first thing you see is the man with the baton. He has his back turned to you, not aware of you approaching.

Then you notice a city guard lying on the ground. Seemingly in pain, the guard holds his head in his hands and makes no attempts to stand up.

Moonlight is shining through the windows, a door is leading outside.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: She slightly changes her position, making the man yelp in pain.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
When taking one of the planks you make more noise than you'd like.

Fortunately, the man with the baton doesn't react to what you are doing.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: With a loud creak the door opens.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Sharp, sudden pain burns through your body. The man with the baton hunches over you, hitting you relentlessly.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
This time the blow lands on his unprotected side.

Wheezing for air, the man collapses.

You don't have any time to celebrate your victory.

The leader of the city guards quickly closes the distance to you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
She narrowly dodges it with a small but calculated sidestep.

Then she grabs your arm and twists it behind your back, all while using your own momentum.

You drop your weapon, gritting your teeth in pain.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000065F
Properties.Text: You won't escape this time!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Cold metal clasps your wrists.

The handcuffs are so tight, they cut into your skin.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You there! What are you doing?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The man stares at you, deep into your eyes. For a moment, it's so quiet that the only sound is the blood pulsating in your ears.

Finally he grunts and turns away from Em and you, continuing his way through the corridor.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: With that he leaves you two alone.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
While the orc is audibly dealing with the lock, you notice a dim light to your left.

The ray of warm light is shining out of a hole in the recess of the wall.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The hole reveals a lavishly decorated room lit in warm tones. 

You see a woman leaning into a bench, she has her head put in the neck. Lazily she brings her hand to the mouth and sucks at a pipe. Slowly she puts her hand back on the bench before finally exhaling a thick cloud of smoke.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Em is holding some tiny looking metal tool in his big hand.

He shifts and moves his right hand in a motion that definitely does not fit a key.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Em doesn't waste any time and opens the door he just unlocked.

This room looks similar to the one you woke up in. A neatly folded set of clothing is lying on the bed's pillow.

Without another word you pass by Em and enter the room.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Em leads you out into a narrow hallway with stuffy air. There are only doors on the right hand side, but you hear muffled voices through the walls on the left.

Em points at the walls and gestures you to be quiet.

The orc opens the first door and peeks inside. Over his shoulder you see a room similar to the one you woke up in. The only difference was that this one does not have a bed in it.

After quickly scanning the room Em closes the door with a gentleness unbefitting his boisterous appearance.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: Aren't we going inside?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Nah, we gotta find some servant's room, probably one with a bed in it. More likely to find a piece of clothing there than in some random closet.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
A man is walking up to you, he is wearing some kind of uniform with the same coat of arms on Em's tunic.

With his left hand he is tightly gripping a baton hanging from his belt.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Oh Sir, am supposed to give the new one his working clothes, Sir!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Em is acting very differently now. He is speaking very fast, his voice has a much higher pitch and he keeps looking at the ground most of the time.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: I don't remember seeing you here, greenskin.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: They all look the same, don't they?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Startled by you suddenly speaking to him, he pulls back from Em.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: What?

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: Greenskins I mean. It's gonna take a while till I can remember the face of that one here.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Startled by you suddenly speaking to him, he pulls back from Em.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: What?

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: I'd like to get my clothing now, I am getting rather cold.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Suddenly, the man thrusts his baton into you stomach. Even if it was not a hard hit, the abruptness left you gasping for air.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Don't get cocky.

I got my eye on you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: But Sir, I been working in the Castellum for three weeks!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The man's eyes narrow as he lowers his baton.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You are not lying to me, are you?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Wouldn't never dream of it, sir!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The man keeps staring at Em.

Finally he pulls away.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Don't make any trouble. I got my eye on you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The two of you continue opening the next few doors until he reaches one that is locked. 

Looking a bit annoyed, he hunches over the lock.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Suddenly he thrusts it into Em's stomach. 

If Em feels any pain, he doesn't show it at all.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The man eyes you from head to toe before turning to Em again. His eyes narrow while inspecting Em's face.

Without taking his eyes off Em for a moment he draws the baton from from his belt.

Slowly he lifts Em's chin up, so that he has to look at the guard.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You there! What are you doing?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: After a bit of wiggling, you hear the final clicking of the lock.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
I may be a bit daft... no, I am very daft.

But I did see that you said that just to distract him from me.

Still... Thank you for apologising. I appreciate it.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: "Almost didn't work" is good enough for me!

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: What do you mean, you are not supposed to be here? And where are we anyway?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: No, they aren't "only there to be fucked".

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
Having one of these women is a status symbol because they are educated.

Knowing stuff makes you interesting, y'know?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Yeah, I find it crazy. Like, how much money must be in there for that to work out?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Rumours say that some concubines end up in important positions and give money back to the Madam.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
There's a whole academy where they train concubines for the rich.

Teach 'em how to eat properly and make 'em study poems and books and stuff.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Yeah, that too, but high-class.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: If you say so.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
Perceptive, aren't you?

I don't have a key, so I had to get the door open otherwise.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: To be honest, I don't know what else I could do for you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Em gives you a subtle smile, then he claps his hands together.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Now, I already spent too much time here, I really need to go. You can manage on your ow-{nw}

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: You have done more than enough. Thank you, Em.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Yeah, I got my moments from time to time.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: While pulling the tunic over your head, you hear him sigh.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
Fortunately you were there! 

By the way: Thanks for the distraction.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: What was that about?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: What do you mean?

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: That act you just put up in front of the guard.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
Alright, listen. I'm not exactly supposed to be here... Telling the truth would just make things more harder.

Thought he wouldn't question me if I was just some docile orc.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: About that... Sorry for saying all orcs look alike.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Oh that? That was awesome!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: I am not the only quick thinker here, eh?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
There are all kinds of fun. Stuff like exotic foods, a theatre, ballrooms, bathhouses. You name it, the Castellum has it.

And if it doesn't have it, the Madam will pull some strings and the Castellum will have it the next week!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: You know, usually I pull distractions out of my arse. You are the first I pulled out of the water!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Em chuckles.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: Not quite the reaction I expected...

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You go to the bed straight away to put on the uniform.

Em follows you into the room but sticks his head out to look in the direction the guard went. After a moment he closes the door.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The orc takes a deep breath.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
For starters I don't work here. I mean, technically I do from time to time... but usually not and not now.

As for the where: We're in the Castellum, meeting place for all the rich folk in Fovis. 

Well... We are in one of the Castellum's buildings. It is its own district... kinda its own city.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Owner of the Castellum. Don't know much about her.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: They say she got some big connections in the city. Uses em to make the Castellum richer.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Say what now?

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text:
Back in the hallway there was a spyhole through a wall.

I could look into another room.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Course there are peepholes here...

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Em shakes his head.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Did you see something interesting?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
Hope she isn't doing dusk weed.

Stuff's been running rampant lately. Vile shit, dangerous.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text:
Maybe one of the concubines.

Was there a client?

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: I didn't see anyone else.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Em shrugs his shoulders.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Oh well.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Suddenly you hear yelling and many heavy footsteps from outside.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000111
Properties.Text: Alright, time for me to go. See you around!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Without waiting for your answer, Morrok bolts out of the room.

While trying to collect your thoughts, you hear a painful cry through the open door.

It's a man's voice, but it doesn't sound like Em's.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: When you are done you see him looking at you apologetically.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: At the end of his speech, Em almost sounds like a merchant trying to sell you something.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000199F
Properties.Text: Leave.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Out of a sudden you hear a voice behind you. You turn to whoever is  speaking to you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The man before you is clearly not one of the sailors. For one he is wearing a high quality armour.

But more important are his pointed ears sticking out of the helmet, revealing him to be an elf.

The elf seems to be completely focused on you, ready to spring into action at a moment's notice.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: Hello to you, too.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: What if I don't?

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000199F
Properties.Text: If you will not leave on your own, I will make you leave.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: His answer came without any hesitation at all, leaving no doubt that he would actually do so.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The eyes of your opponent narrow while he ever so slightly shifts his stance.

The elf pushes his his sword just a little bit out of the sheath, indicating that he is willing to draw his weapon.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: As you are about to take your leave, you notice a pair of two men walking up to the two of you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text: Come on, don't let your guard bother that man! He is a passenger just like we are, isn't he?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The boisterous man speaks loud enough to his elven company to make the guard turn his head.

After inspecting you for a short moment the elf in the robes nods barely noticeably. It was enough to for the guard to stand aside, first bowing to the elf then to the human.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: Come and try.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: You are not the captain, you can't order people around.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: Relax, I'll go already.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The three of you take in the view without speaking a word.

Finally, Durenar breaks the silence.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text: It is beautiful, isn't it?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000593
Properties.Text: It is just like I remember.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The elf's voice is quiet, almost inaudible due to the waves hitting the bow of the ship.

Suddenly mister Durenar becomes lively and turns to the elf.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The man walks up to where you are standing. Once he reached the rail he smiled, genuinely happy to see the view.

His elven company follows him with the same neutral expression as before.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The man makes a dismissive gesture.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text: It was nothing, just a small misunderstanding.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The man sighs condescendingly as if talking to a child.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text: Word of advice, boy: Money rules the world. The sooner you accept the fact, the better your life will be.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
On the deck of the ship the sailors are buzzing with activity, executing the first mate's commands in a well rehearsed manner.

The wind tugs at your tunic and small sprinkles of water spray on your face as the ship cuts through the sea.

In the dark water you see reflections of the white moonlight and also some kind of blue light, but you cannot see where it is coming from.

You go upstairs to the front of the deck where you'd have a better view and wouldn't stand in the sailors' way.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
A castle on cliffs pierces through the mist on the water, its highest tower emits a supernatural light.

Like a superstitious night guard the castle is reminding everyone of its watchful presence and shines its light upon anyone that dares to come closer.

To the feet of the castle you see countless small dots of warmer light making the city of Fovis, "the city that never sleeps".

Considering the numerous lights the citizens either really live up to their city's nickname, or Fovis must be incredibly vast. Maybe both.

In front of the bay of Fovis, there is a city wall with massive towers. Lights shine through the windows there too, showing that the city guard also never sleeps.

The ship is swaying gently on the waves, and it would be serene if not for the sailors shouting and calling around you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You acknowledge the man with a nod but otherwise remain silent. Durenar doesn't mind, apparently having lost any interest in you already.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Half talking to the elf, half talking to himself, the man doesn't let go of the view he admires.

Apparently lost in thought, it takes a moment before the elf answers.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text: Maybe this view is the same, my dear Naverion. But I can assure you that Fovis changed a lot in the last decades!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: The man gives Naverion a sly smile.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text: Or how do you think I could lift your banishment?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Instead of answering the elf acknowledges the man with a nod. Then he continues to look at the castle.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000593
Properties.Text: How did the Mages Guild react?

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text: They huffed and puffed and went back to their castle. There is nothing they can do.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text:
I already told you, Fovis has changed. The Mages Guild is not the same institution it was twenty years ago.

If the rumours about their debt is true -and they are- then the guild will even be forced to sell their precious castle.

Properties.Speaker: 0x010000000000199F
Properties.Text: Mylord. Mister Durenar.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Naverion raises an eyebrow.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Mister Durenar turns to look at the castle again.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text: And I'll be ready.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Again the three of you take in the view of the castle in silence, captivated by the awe-inspiring sight.

With time you note that the ship is not heading for the castle but for the walls on the right instead.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
At first the towers did not seem to get any bigger. But now after getting closer you see that there are houses at the foot of the tower that look miniscule in comparison.

They are more fishing huts than proper houses, even in the darkness you can guess how shabby they are. The wind blows an intense smell of fish from the huts to the ship.

The ship is slowing down its approach in order to dock there.

After docking two people left the ship and made their way towards the tower. The first being the captain, the second one is the sailor that went to the storage room to get the crate he is carrying right now.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text: Getting an entry permit shouldn't take too long when they see my seal on the paperwork.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
A couple of orcs are sluggishly drinking from crude mugs while looking back at the ship you are on. If they are talking, it's too quiet for you to hear.

One of the orcs is lazily leaning forward and spits in the direction of the ship. You can't help but feel that he is looking directly at you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Finally the captain and his sailor return and the ship slowly enters the city's bay.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
First you see simple houses made of timber. Most of them are low-rise buildings with some tall ones towering above them. Here and there are also huts like the ones outside the walls.

While passing you see orcs and humans working together, loading and unloading ships deep in the night. Supervisors yell their instructions and somewhere two people have a noisy quarrel.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The buildings are decorated with crests or flags, probably of the families living in them. Below the houses you see openings for what seems to be the sewerage.

Apart from a carriage and some night watchmen this side seems to be rather quiet, at least in comparison to the noise of the other side.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
You notice that the guard is still eyeing you cautiously. Now that you are looking at him, he turns to you but doesn't say anything.

Before you can react to the distrustful guard, you notice something glowing on the balcony of a nearby house.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Someone is standing there and holding some sort of blue light.

Suddenly they lunge and throw the glowing thing. The light flies in a high arch towards the ship's bow.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The thing seems to be some metallic ball.

There are openings emitting this bright blue light.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text: What is-{nw}

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Without being asked, Durenar speaks into the silence. But neither Naverion nor his guard seem to be interested in talking.

You let your gaze wander over the huts again. In one of the lit ones, you can spot a couple of people.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text: Unpleasant fellows, aren't they?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Mister Durenar speaks to you, apparently catching who you are looking at.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text: The orcs I mean. They can be hard workers for sure. But by the heavens are they thickheaded!

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text:
Oh boy, you have no idea. Let me tell you, hundreds if not thousands work for me. Normal people, but also greenskins.

Do you honestly believe normal folk caused nearly as much trouble as the orcs?

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text: Believe me, it's certainly not a pleasure!

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text: Smart! On their own, they make nothing but trouble.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text:
If they are not lead by a strong hand, they revert back to their savage, belligerent ways.

From what I have experienced there's just something inherently wrong with greenskins.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text: Oh please! Humans live like that too and they don't feel the need to bash their foreman's head in with a club!

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text: Ha! I am too old for that bullshit. If you'd seen the greenskins behaving the same over and over again, you wouldn't say that. Trust me.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text: Their nature! Thicker skin and more muscles but smaller brains, something like that.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: Why do you deal with orcs at all if they give you that much trouble?

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006A5
Properties.Text:
You see, they are suited to work in my mines due to their skin. They can handle exposure to the raw materials better than humans.

And now that so many of them came and work here you cannot exactly throw them out at once. That would just introduce a whole lot of new trouble.

The greenskins themselves have to realise that there is nothing for them here, then they'll leave by themselves.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Up ahead the houses get sturdier and taller, often with the ground floor made out of stone and the roof made out of tiles. Canals separate blocks of houses with bridges spanning across.

You hear people in a festive mood coming from some inn. Two drunken women try to sing a song but interrupt themselves time and time again with their own laughter.

The ship enters a canal big enough for two ships to pass each other. Smaller channels branch off the main one with numerous ferryboats floating in them.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Land ho!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
Instinctively you raise your hand to shield your eyes from the bright moonlight.

Slowly your eyes adjust to the dark storage room you had to sleep in.

You hear the steps of the stairs are creaking, someone is coming down to your room.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: One of the sailors enters, a short but wiry man. Apparently looking for something he speaks to you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000879
Properties.Text: Hey there, sir. We are 'bout to reach the city of Fovis. Slept well?

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000879
Properties.Text:
Not that the cap'n liked to put you down here.

But if the head of council turns up one day before departure and tells him to make room for a special guest and their entourage? Nothing he could do, really.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: Next time I will insist on a cabin, that's for sure.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You are about to go upstairs but the sailor stops you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000879
Properties.Text:
...didn't happen to see some bottles of schnapps here, did you?

's a present for the city guard. Will get us in faster.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000879
Properties.Text: No reason to be an arse 'bout it.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000879
Properties.Text: 's alright.

Properties.Speaker: 0x01000000000006B0
Properties.Text: Right there, under the blanket.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000879
Properties.Text: Right you are, thanks!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000879
Properties.Text: Enjoy the view! Fovis at night really is a sight to behold! But try to not stand in anyone's way.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000879
Properties.Text: If you wanna go up, don't stand in anyone's way!

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Once again you turn to the stairs.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You hear the words of the sailor behind you while climbing up the creaky stairs.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You get up from your uncomfortable makeshift bed.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
The sudden yell wakes you from your sleep. Slowly you realise how uncomfortable the sacks under you are and wish you could have gotten your cabin as planned.

At least the ship is swaying only lightly at the moment, the sea seems to be calm tonight.

The sailors on the other hand are anything but calm.

From above, you hear orders being yelled and planks creaking under hasty steps.

Unable to find back to your sleep, you open your eyes.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: Your back is still hurting from the little sleep you could get.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000879
Properties.Text: You didn't know? That's Gunbald Durenar! 's probably the richest man alive.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: You shrug your shoulders.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000879
Properties.Text: Got filthy rich with mining that magical stuff. Anything with magic is insanely expensive, I tell you.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000879
Properties.Text:
Some elf. Seems to be high-level, maybe one of their noblemen.

Probably one of those fuckers who's been messing with our city for a century.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text: He spits on the ground as if he needed to cleanse the taste of the words he just said.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0100000000000879
Properties.Text:
Or are you asking 'bout who's sleeping in your cabin? That would be the guards.

Can't have a fucking elven nobleman sleeping in a bed made for us mere mortals.

Properties.Speaker: 0x0000000000000000
Properties.Text:
PC wakes up

This document shall contain names of entities and their explanation

The city Rogues and Thieves plays in. Also the name of the peninsula.

Fovis = fodere (dig) + vis (might)

The city was founded to mine Lavirium, a rare magical mineral. 

Fovis is also called "Harbour of the Eastern Sea" due to its importance as a trading hub.

The oldest and most prosperous district of Fovis. It was founded after men expelled elves from Fovis.

Viastis = victoria (victory) + iustis (of the just)

Another name is "Old guard", as it once had been a fortified bulwark against elves.

The district of the middle class in Fovis. It was founded after Viastis became to small. 

Yugatt = "New Guard" over time
The newest and poorest part of Fovis.

"The Castellum" is a semi-independent enclave on the border between Viastis and Yugatt. Originally one of Viastis' fortresses, now it is known for the entertainment it offers to those who can afford it.
A rare and expensive magical mineral found on the Fovis' peninsula.
This document contains the documentation for custom templates.

Parent: FlowFragment

Description: Everything in its Text field will be executed as RenPy code

Usage: simple display of images

Parent: FlowFragment

Description: Everything in its Text field will be the jump label of this element in RenPy files

Usage: the jump labels of these elements are used by manually written RenPy code

Example: Text='label_after_minigame', the manually written minigame can now jump to this label if it is finished
Parent: DialogueFragment

Everything in it will be displayed in the game as a choice in a menu of choices.

If StageDirections does not contain 'dont_repeat_menu_text', then the text will be repeated after the RenPy code in the field 'Text' will be computed.
Everything in Text will be executed as RenPy code after the player chose this choice

This field may contain the following:

 - (optionally) an integer to control the order in which choices shall be displayed

 - (optionally) the string 'dont_repeat_menu_text' if MenuText shall not be repeated after the code in Text is executed

This template is useful if a choice shall be displayed to the player, after choosing it an image shall be shown and finally the text of the choice is displayed. For example, the player has the option to say "Screw you!", they choose it, an image of the angry Player character is shown and then the text "Screw you!"
RenPy code can be written directly into RenPyBox models. The code should be small, e.g. just showing a new scene image.

The command to show a new scene image in RenPy is as follows:

scene image 'PATH_TO_IMAGE' with dissolve

As it is tedious and error prone to write the whole image path, there are alternative ways to reference image paths. They all assume that the image directory in RenPy's game folder contains the same structure as the FlowFragments in Articy. 

For example, assume the uppermost FlowFragment is called game and it contains first_chapter and second_chapter, which themselves contain both first_scene, second_scene, etc. Then RenPy's game/images folder will contain first_chapter/first_scene/, first_chapter/second_scene/, second_chapter/first_scene/, second_chapter/second_scene/, etc. So for each FlowFragment there will be a folder in the image directory.

tl;dr: 

scene image {image_name.png} with dissolve

Let's assume that the RenPyBox which contains this code is in the following flow structure:

game/first_chapter/second_scene

Then the custom Articy to RenPy converter will replace {image_name} in "scene image {image_name} with dissolve" with:

scene image 'images/game/first_chapter/second_scene/image_name.png' with dissolve

tl;dr: 

scene image {../image_name.png} with dissolve

Let's assume that the RenPyBox which contains this code is in the following flow structure:

game/first_chapter/second_scene

Then the custom Articy to RenPy converter will replace {../image_name} in "scene image {../image_name} with dissolve" with:

scene image 'images/game/first_chapter/image_name.png' with dissolve

It is possible to go up multiple levels in the folder hierarchy with multiple "../".

tl;dr: 

scene image {dir_name/image_name.png} with dissolve

Let's assume that the RenPyBox which contains this code is in the following flow structure:

game/first_chapter

Then the custom Articy to RenPy converter will replace {second_scene/image_name} in "scene image {second_scene/image_name} with dissolve" with:

scene image 'images/game/first_chapter/second_scene/image_name.png' with dissolve

It is possible to go down multiple levels in the folder hierarchy with the mention of multiple directories.

Properties.DisplayName: Image in different folder on same level
Properties.Text:
tl;dr: 

scene image {../dir_name/image_name.png} with dissolve

Let's assume that the RenPyBox which contains this code is in the following flow structure:

game/first_chapter/first_scene

Then the custom Articy to RenPy converter will replace {../second_scene/image_name} in "scene image {../second_scene/image_name} with dissolve" with:

scene image 'images/game/second_chapter/second_scene/image_name.png' with dissolve

This document will explain how entity names from Articy are displayed in RenPy. In RenPy there is a difference between static and dynamic characters, the former cannot change their name while the latter can.

A static character is created for each character entity that does not have a reference to a variable set. As of 2022-07-20 the feature "Feature Variable Set" contains a property "Variables Set Name". If a character does not have such a feature or a value in that property, then it is considered to be a static character. In that case, its Display Name will be used as its static name.

A dynamic character is created for each character entity that has a reference to a variable set. As of 2022-07-20 the feature "Feature Variable Set" contains a property "Variables Set Name". If a character has such a feature and a value in that property, then it is considered to be a dynamic character. 

In that case, its dynamic name will be "<VALUE_OF_PROPERTY>.display_name". <VALUE_OF_PROPERTY> is the name of a variable set in Articy and the name of the namespace in RenPy that gets created from that variable set.

Assume we have a character entity called "Caya" and an associated variable set "caya" with the variable "display_name". Then the name of the entity may be changed with an Articy instruction 'caya.display_name = "NEW_NAME"'. There will be no change of the display name in the presentation mode of Articy, but the name of the character will change in the RenPy code.
